AbUNdANT eNdOCOelIC mARgINAl pROjeCTIONS, eACh WITh AN ACRORhAgUS WITh hOlOTRIChS. DISTAl VeSICleS AbUNdANT ANd jUmbled. Deep fOSSe. FUllY eXpANded ORAl dISC ANd TeNTACleS TO 51 mm dIAmeTeR, ORAl dISC TO 37 mm dIAmeTeR IN pReSeRVed SpeCImeNS. Up TO 164 TeNTACleS, heXAmeROUSlY ARRANged IN SIX CYCleS, TO 12 mm leNgTh IN pReSeRVed SpeCImeNS, SImple, STICkY, SmOOTh, All Of SImIlAR leNgTh. MeSeNTeRIAl INSeRTIONS VISIble IN pedAl dISC ANd ORAl dISC.

INTeRNAl ANATOmY ANd mICROANATOmY ( FIg. 10 ): MeSeNTeRIeS heXAmeROUSlY ARRANged IN fIVe CYCleS: fIRST TO ThIRd CYCleS peRfeCT; ReST ImpeRfeCT. All meSeNTeRIeS feRTIle eXCepT dIReCTIVeS. GONOChORIC, OOCYTeS 0.09–0.12 mm IN dIAmeTeR IN SpeCImeNS COlleCTed IN JUlY. TWO SIphONOglYphS ATTAChed TO TWO pAIRS Of dIReCTIVe meSeNTeRIeS. SAme NUmbeR Of meSeNTeRIeS dISTAllY ANd pROXImAllY. ReTRACTOR mUSCleS STRONg ANd dIffUSe, OCCUpYINg OVeR hAlf-leNgTh Of meSeNTeRIeS. PARIeTObASIlAR mUSCleS WITh STRONg ANd ThICk fRee meSOgleAl lAmellA. BASIlAR mUSCleS Well deVelOped, WITh ShORT ANd ThICk meSOgleAl pROCeSSeS. MARgINAl SphINCTeR mUSCle CIRCUmSCRIbed. LONgITUdINAl mUSCleS Of TeNTACleS ANd ORAl dISC eCTOdeRmAl.
CNIdOm ( FIg. 11 ): BASITRIChS, hOlOTRIChS, b -mASTIgOphOReS, p -mASTIgOphOReS A ANd B1, ANd SpIROCYSTS. See TAble 5 fOR SIZe ANd dISTRIbUTION.

Geographic and bathymetric distribution.
Bunodosoma grande
IS fOUNd AlONg The PACIfIC OCeAN fROm PeRU, PANAmA, NICARAgUA ANd ECUAdOR beTWeeN 1–20 meTeRS ( VeRRIll 1869 , 1870 ; FAUTIN et al. 2007). IT hAS beeN AlSO RepORTed IN COSTA RICA bY ACUñA et al . (2013), hOWeVeR We CONSIdeRed ThIS ReCORd dUbIOUS (See RemARkS belOW). IN AddITION, CONTRARY TO FAUTIN (2013) TheRe IS NOT meNTION Of
B. grande
OCCURRINg IN LA PAZ (MeXICO) bY VeRRIll (1870) . ThIS IS The fIRST RepORT fOR MeXICO. IN LA PAZ BAY, IT WAS fOUNd IN PUNTA COYOTe NORTh 1, IN The INTeRTIdAl ZONe beTWeeN 1–5 meTeRS.

Remarks. VeRRIll (1869) deSCRIbed
Bunodosoma grande
fROm PeRU, PANAmA ANd NICARAgUA AS A NeW SpeCIeS bASed ONlY ON eXTeRNAl ChARACTeRISTICS. CARlgReN (1950) ReeXAmINed The mATeRIAl ANd INClUded dATA Of The SIZe RANgeS Of The CNIdAe; he STATed ThAT
B. grande
dOeS NOT ReSemble ANY OTheR SpeCIeS WIThIN The geNUS OR ANY SpeCIeS fROm The GUlf Of CAlIfORNIA. HOWeVeR, ShORTlY AfTeR, CARlgReN (1951) ReVISed The SpeCImeNS fROm The GUlf Of CAlIfORNIA ANd ReAlIZed TheRe WAS A SpeCIeS ReSemblINg
B. grande ;
he deSCRIbed IT AS A NeW SpeCIeS,
B . californicum
( CARlgReN 1951 ). The ReCORd Of
B. grande
fROm ACUñA et al . (2013) IN The PACIfIC COAST Of COSTA RICA IS NOT RelIAble beCAUSe The AUThORS dId NOT pROVIde ANY deSCRIpTION, ImAgeS Of ANATOmY OR CNIdAe dATA. HOWeVeR, beCAUSe ThIS SpeCIeS hAS beeN SO fAR RepORTed fURTheR NORTh (MeXICO, pReSeNT STUdY) ANd SOUTh (ECUAdOR) AlONg The PACIfIC COAST, The SpeCIeS IS pRObAblY AlSO dISTRIbUTed IN COSTA RICA . NeVeRTheleSS, The RepORT bY ACUñA et al . (2013) hAS TO be CONfIRmed WITh RelIAble dATA fROm COSTA RICA , OR fROm ReeXAmINATION Of The SpeCImeNS TheY STUdIed.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 9. External anatomy of
Bunodosoma grande (Verrill, 1869)
. A–B) Lateral view of preserved and living specimen, respectively. C) Oral view of living specimen. D) Detail of acrorhagi. E) Specimen in situ . Acrorhagi (Ac), Oral disc (Od), Vesicle (V). Scale bar: 5 mm.

FIGURE 10. Internal anatomy of
Bunodosoma grande (Verrill, 1869)
. A) Longitudinal section of the distal column. B) Cross section of the column at the level of the actinopharynx showing the cycles of mesenteries (cycles marked by numbers). C) Cross section through a tentacle showing ectodermal longitudinal musculature. D) Longitudinal section of proximal end showing basilar muscles. E) Cross section of column showing gametogenic tissue. F) Cross section of column showing parietobasilar muscles. G) Detail of a cross section of the column at the level of the actinopharynx showing the retractor and parietobasilar muscles. Acrorhagi (Ac), Basilar muscles (Ba), Ectoderm (Ec), Endoderm (En), Fosse (Fo), Marginal projections (Mp), Mesoglea (Me), Oocytes (O) Parietobasilar muscles (Pa), Retractor muscles (Re), Siphonoglyphs (arrows), Sphincter (Sp), Vesicle (V). Scale bars: A, C–F, 0.1 mm; B, 0.5 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
IN The pReSeNT STUdY, We ObSeRVed SeVeRAl dIffeReNCeS beTWeeN
B . californicum
ANd
B . grande
: 1) VeSICleS IN The COlUmN Of
B . californicum
ARe dISTINCTlY ARRANged IN lONgITUdINAl ROWS WheReAS IN
B . grande The
VeSICleS ARe mORe AbUNdANT, ANd eVeN IN RelAXed SpeCImeNS IT IS VeRY dIffICUlT TO dISTINgUISh Them AS ARRANged IN lONgITUdINAl ROWS ( FIgS. 6A, B ANd 9A, B , ReSpeCTIVelY); 2) dISTAl VeSICleS fORmINg The mARgINAl pROjeCTIONS Of
B . californicum
ARe NOT AS AbUNdANT AS IN
B . grande
, IN WhICh VeSICleS ARe SO AbUNdANT ThAT TheY COUld be SeeN AS A dISTAl COllAR ( FIgS. 9A, B ); TheSe TWO dIffeReNCeS AllOW dISTINgUIShINg bOTh SpeCIeS IN The fIeld; ANd 3) pARIeTObASIlAR mUSCleS IN
B . californicum
ARe WeAkeR ANd ThINNeR ThAN ThOSe IN
B. grande
, WhICh ARe STRONgeR ANd ThICkeR ( FIgS. 7F ANd 10F , ReSpeCTIVelY). CARlgReN (1950) meNTIONed NO CNIdAe IN The COlUmN, NO SpIROCYSTS IN The TeNTACleS, NO p - mASTIgOphOReS A IN The ACTINOphARYNX, ANd NO b -mASTIgOphOReS IN fIlAmeNTS. AlSO, The AUThOR USed The TeRm ATRIChS WhICh fITS VeRY Well WITh The SIZe Of hOlOTRIChS. ThIS lACk Of TYpeS Of CNIdAe IS dUe TO The bAd pReSeRVATION Of The SpeCImeNS The AUThOR ObSeRVed. HOWeVeR, The SIZeS RANgeS Of The CNIdAe he pROVIded fITS VeRY Well WITh The pReSeNT STUdY. The CNIdAe RepORTed fROm The SpeCImeNS STUdIed bY FAUTIN et al . (2007) IN The GAlApAgOS ISlANdS ARe SlIghTlY dIffeReNT fROm The ONeS RepORTed heRe. TheY fOUNd NO NemATOCYSTS IN The mARgINAl pROjeCTIONS, NO b -mASTIgOphOReS IN The fIlAmeNT, ANd ONlY lARgeR p -mASTIgOphOReS A IN The fIlAmeNTS (See TAble 5). AlThOUgh TheSe dIffeReNCeS COUld be dUe TO INTRASpeCIfIC VARIATION, We RATheR TAke ThIS ReCORd WITh CAUTION UNTIl IT CAN be fURTheR CONfIRmed.
